title: #25 The Auralnauts (Craven Moorhaus and Zak Koonce): Funeral DJs, lightsaber ASMR, Howard the Duck
itunes:title: The Auralnauts (Craven Moorhaus and Zak Koonce): Funeral DJs, lightsaber ASMR, Howard the Duck
description:
Full transcript: https://followfridaypodcast.com/auralnauts (FollowFridayPodcast.com/auralnauts)
Back us on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/followfriday (Patreon.com/followfriday)
Review us: https://lovethepodcast.com/followfriday (LoveThePodcast.com/followfriday)
~
Craven Moorhaus and Zak Koonce owe it all to Bane. Craven, an audio designer, and Koonce, a comedy writer, teamed up as the https://www.youtube.com/c/Auralnauts/videos (Auralnauts) in 2012 to dub over scenes from The Dark Knight Rises.
"Because [Bane] had a mask on, and you could make him say https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IkMPZ7WeDck (whatever we wanted), so we just changed the context of everything that was happening and we turned him into this weird fitness freak," Koonce says. "And then he just raps to this audience who is clearly not expecting it, and is not into it."
Nine years later and 300,000 subscribers later, they've made dozens of videos dubbing over https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P-oK9mnTbyI (TV commercials), https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sAmyZP-qbTE (Boston Dynamics' robot tests), and https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KU_Jdts5rL0 (many), https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LjuLcceCm-U (many) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WSCm8yAxBr8 (Star Wars movies). On today's Follow Friday, the Auralnauts talk about four great accounts they follow online: A https://www.youtube.com/c/PopCultureDetectiveAgency/videos (YouTube essayist) who unpacks the hidden layers of pop culture; "the https://twitter.com/Michael1979 (most wholesome troll) that exists in the world"; a https://www.youtube.com/c/FredsVoice/videos (dorky ASMR expert) with a "connected universe" of characters; and an https://www.instagram.com/catatonicyouths/ (Instagram account) that curates "so bad, it's so good" music.
You can get a fifth follow recommendation from the Auralnauts — as well as our past and future guests — when you https://www.patreon.com/followfriday (back Follow Friday on Patreon), starting at just $1 a month.
Follow us:
- https://www.youtube.com/c/Auralnauts/videos (Auralnauts on YouTube)
- This show is on https://twitter.com/followfridaypod (Twitter), https://www.instagram.com/followfridaypod/ (Instagram), and https://www.tiktok.com/@followfridaypod/ (TikTok) @followfridaypod
- Eric is https://twitter.com/HeyHeyESJ (on Twitter @heyheyesj)
Theme song written by Eric Johnson, and performed by https://www.fiverr.com/yonamarie (Yona Marie). Show art by https://www.fiverr.com/dodiihr (Dodi Hermawan). 
Thank you to our amazing patrons: Jon, Justin, and Elizabeth
content:encoded:
Full transcript: FollowFridayPodcast.com/auralnauts

Back us on Patreon: Patreon.com/followfriday

Review us: LoveThePodcast.com/followfriday

~

Craven Moorhaus and Zak Koonce owe it all to Bane. Craven, an audio designer, and Koonce, a comedy writer, teamed up as the Auralnauts in 2012 to dub over scenes from The Dark Knight Rises.

"Because [Bane] had a mask on, and you could make him say whatever we wanted, so we just changed the context of everything that was happening and we turned him into this weird fitness freak," Koonce says. "And then he just raps to this audience who is clearly not expecting it, and is not into it."

Nine years later and 300,000 subscribers later, they've made dozens of videos dubbing over TV commercials, Boston Dynamics' robot tests, and many, many Star Wars movies. On today's Follow Friday, the Auralnauts talk about four great accounts they follow online: A YouTube essayist who unpacks the hidden layers of pop culture; "the most wholesome troll that exists in the world"; a dorky ASMR expert with a "connected universe" of characters; and an Instagram account that curates "so bad, it's so good" music.

You can get a fifth follow recommendation from the Auralnauts — as well as our past and future guests — when you back Follow Friday on Patreon, starting at just $1 a month.

Follow us:

- Auralnauts on YouTube

- This show is on Twitter, Instagram, and TikTok @followfridaypod

- Eric is on Twitter @heyheyesj

Theme song written by Eric Johnson, and performed by Yona Marie. Show art by Dodi Hermawan.

Thank you to our amazing patrons: Jon, Justin, and Elizabeth
dc:creator: LightningPod.fm
